metadata.Title: CVE-2022-1097 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: NSSToken objects were referenced via direct points, and could have been accessed in an unsafe way on different threads, leading to a use-after-free and potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 91.8, Firefox < 99, and Firefox ESR < 91.8. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1097` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: firefox - 99.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2 firefox-geckodriver - 99.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2 firefox-mozsymbols - 99.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2 No subscription required thunderbird - 1:91.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '99.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
